Text: This disappointing download took many hours to download files .r00 - .r18 plus a corrupted and unexpandable .rar file. I suppose I COULD open a unix terminal and paste all those .rnn files into one file that may or may not be readable, but I'd really rather not.

After @semisaname 's encouraging comment I decided to try this torrent again. I downloaded a fresh copy and used VLC to open the directory where all the .rnn files were stored. VLC threw up several errors, which I ignored because it looked as if VLC was reading the rar files (slowly, one-by-one) into the buffer at the same time. After a little over an hour all the files were in the buffer and the video began to play! 

VLC is awesome - what other player could do this? Send 'em a donation!

I can not for the life of me understand why people take so much trouble to upload files but do so in a form most programs will not subsequently convert---to wach on the pc this is fine but i have yet to find anything that will convert it to dvd!
If you intend burning to DVD don't bother downloading this torrent until it is fixed because call.the.midwife.s01e04.720p.hdtv.x264-tla.rar archive is corrupt.
